snippet: Got mostly everything I needed fair prices great choices

No accountability when online order went missing. Store claimed delivery driver knocked. I had been home with windows open. No one knocked the door. Can’t get through direct to Oldbury on phone. Won’t trust them again.

Wot can l say! This is my beloved SavaCentre and locals from the 80's would remember it as such. It was probably one of the first hypermarkets in the West Mids. I remember going there in my dad's old Escort (really old car) and it and everything you could ask for; food, clothing at the time, toys and lots of them. Good selection of food and they also sell small electrical items and gaming in addition to stationary. This also have a branch of Timpson.  I would wholeheartedly recommend this branch of Sainsbury's (Why break the habit of a lifetime; I still call it SavaCentre).
Easy parking, although very busy managed to get what I needed, lots of self check outs, good verity of products and good quality with reasonable prices.

Do not park here, it says 3 hours free parking, I was 25 minutes, got a parking fine for £85...said I was parked for over 7 hours..times were wrong on letter and they had my exit time as entry time...avoid at all costs, get over to Aldi across the road, no problems parking on the retail park and a lot cheaper for your groceries minus the £85 rip off parking charges.
There is a Lloyd's pharmacy, Argos ,Timpson, and  sainsbury Bank,  and a cafe , toilet ,sainsbury  fule Station and  car wash, travel money, and  Western Union . car park ,very nice children car park

Awful Sainsbury's. Always under stocked and under staffed. It's always a lottery whether you can actually get what you want, despite workers constantly seeming to be stocking to avoid working the tills. Multiple homeless people allowed to use the front as their base of operations, heckling/insulting you if you don't give them change. They're never moved along and practically live there.
I've been a loyal customer at this Sainsbury's for years but I'm reaching my limit, will be shopping at the new Aldi if these issues aren't resolved soon.

After finding the supply entrance on foot I then had to take a 15 minute walk around the pedometer wall (reminiscent of the outside of a prison). I keep walking song nothing but all after wall as can be seen by my photos. Eventually I find some trolleys next to a big double door with steel over them saying "No Entry". I start wondering if I've walked into Wonderland as nothing is making sense. I go around a Timpson and finally hooray the entrance. Only in yam yam land could such a place exist. The inside was just as confusing following noon of the normal rules of a supermarket.

Customer service is absolutely dreadful, particularly on the self-service tils. The shelves are never, ever fully stocked, out of date products are often left on the shelves, the shelves are never tidied, so by the end of the day products are all over the place, including chilled products left out of the refrigerators. All in all, the worst Sainsburys in the local area by a long, long way.
Very big store, plenty of options for food and great collection of cloths. Large parking space free for 3 hrs.

Always love a Quick Look in Sainsbury’s.
Toilets could be better maintained but the rest of the shop is fine.
Very helpful loads of stuff at good prices to buy

Sainsburry I was shock when I went to ask about the toilet a woman and a guy say to me the toilet is out of order even   am disabled I did not get anyone to help me and also they have people still park  car in disability bay very shame to see that.CAN SAINSBURRY SORT THERE TOILET IS OUT OF ORDER DISABLED TOILET AND WOMAN TOILET
Terrible location and horrendous parking with no carpark lighting at all and zero organisation of shopping trolleys had to drive upto tescos instead

I came to this store looking for some chocolates and this lovely worker named Joshua I believe had helped me to find all chocolates and was a great lad to talk to. Talked about anything and made it very comfortable and a welcoming experience.

Toilets were disgusting never seen anything like it , there was excrement and urine  on the floor used toilet paper everywhere, and my god it stunk they didn't need signs you could smell them coming. Also bought clothing stupidly didn't check the clothes were the same size as the hanger.

Nice super store with ample parking.. Friendly staff and good  variety of stuff you would expect from Sainsbury supermarket. The bunnies were looking very angry, they were super soft and perfect gift for a little one, no pun intended..

We had a stop for Argos too and as expected the staff was friendly and happy to help..

Nice to get some bargains, and last year I got two weeks Family Xmas shopping "for free" using my nectar points 😀, but what happend to the ps and Xbox games at the blackheath store 🤔 Great having Argos in the store now 👍
Lovely shop, helpful staff. Large variety of products, ample parking space.
The shop was well arranged and had a lot of space to move around and check items. Pastries are of highest quality.
Got mostly everything I needed fair prices great choices

No accountability when online order went missing. Store claimed delivery driver knocked. I had been home with windows open. No one knocked the door. Can’t get through direct to Oldbury on phone. Won’t trust them again.

The shelves are never, ever fully stocked, out of date products are often left on the shelves, the shelves are never tidied, so by the end of the day products are all over the place, including chilled products left out of the refrigerators. All in all, the worst Sainsburys in the local area by a long, long way.
Very big store, plenty of options for food and great collection of cloths. Large parking space free for 3 hrs.

Always love a Quick Look in Sainsbury’s.
Toilets could be better maintained but the rest of the shop is fine.
Very helpful loads of stuff at good prices to buy

Sainsburry I was shock when I went to ask about the toilet a woman and a guy say to me the toilet is out of order even   am disabled I did not get anyone to help me and also they have people still park  car in disability bay very shame to see that.CAN SAINSBURRY SORT THERE TOILET IS OUT OF ORDER DISABLED TOILET AND WOMAN TOILET
Terrible location and horrendous parking with no carpark lighting at all and zero organisation of shopping trolleys had to drive upto tescos instead

I came to this store looking for some chocolates and this lovely worker named Joshua I believe had helped me to find all chocolates and was a great lad to talk to. Talked about anything and made it very comfortable and a welcoming experience.

Toilets were disgusting never seen anything like it , there was excrement and urine  on the floor used toilet paper everywhere, and my god it stunk they didn't need signs you could smell them coming. Also bought clothing stupidly didn't check the clothes were the same size as the hanger.

Nice super store with ample parking.. Friendly staff and good  variety of stuff you would expect from Sainsbury supermarket. The bunnies were looking very angry, they were super soft and perfect gift for a little one, no pun intended..

We had a stop for Argos too and as expected the staff was friendly and happy to help..

Nice to get some bargains, and last year I got two weeks Family Xmas shopping "for free" using my nectar points 😀, but what happend to the ps and Xbox games at the blackheath store 🤔 Great having Argos in the store now 👍
Lovely shop, helpful staff. Large variety of products, ample parking space.
The shop was well arranged and had a lot of space to move around and check items. Pastries are of highest quality.
Got mostly everything I needed fair prices great choices

No accountability when online order went missing. Store claimed delivery driver knocked. I had been home with windows open. No one knocked the door. Can’t get through direct to Oldbury on phone. Won’t trust them again.

Wot can l say! This is my beloved SavaCentre and locals from the 80's would remember it as such. It was probably one of the first hypermarkets in the West Mids. I remember going there in my dad's old Escort (really old car) and it and everything you could ask for; food, clothing at the time, toys and lots of them. Good selection of food and they also sell small electrical items and gaming in addition to stationary. This also have a branch of Timpson.  I would wholeheartedly recommend this branch of Sainsbury's (Why break the habit of a lifetime; I still call it SavaCentre).
Easy parking, although very busy managed to get what I needed, lots of self check outs, good verity of products and good quality with reasonable prices.

Do not park here, it says 3 hours free parking, I was 25 minutes, got a parking fine for £85...said I was parked for over 7 hours..times were wrong on letter and they had my exit time as entry time...avoid at all costs, get over to Aldi across the road, no problems parking on the retail park and a lot cheaper for your groceries minus the £85 rip off parking charges.
There is a Lloyd's pharmacy, Argos ,Timpson, and  sainsbury Bank,  and a cafe , toilet ,sainsbury  fule Station and  car wash, travel money, and  Western Union . car park ,very nice children car park

Awful Sainsbury's. Always under stocked and under staffed. It's always a lottery whether you can actually get what you want, despite workers constantly seeming to be stocking to avoid working the tills. Multiple homeless people allowed to use the front as their base of operations, heckling/insulting you if you don't give them change. They're never moved along and practically live there.
I've been a loyal customer at this Sainsbury's for years but I'm reaching my limit, will be shopping at the new Aldi if these issues aren't resolved soon.

After finding the supply entrance on foot I then had to take a 15 minute walk around the pedometer wall (reminiscent of the outside of a prison). I keep walking song nothing but all after wall as can be seen by my photos. Eventually I find some trolleys next to a big double door with steel over them saying "No Entry". I start wondering if I've walked into Wonderland as nothing is making sense. I go around a Timpson and finally hooray the entrance. Only in yam yam land could such a place exist. The inside was just as confusing following noon of the normal rules of a supermarket.

Customer service is absolutely dreadful, particularly on the self-service tils. The shelves are never, ever fully stocked, out of date products are often left on the shelves, the shelves are never tidied, so by the end of the day products are all over the place, including chilled products left out of the refrigerators. All in all, the worst Sainsburys in the local area by a long, long way.
Very big store, plenty of options for food and great collection of cloths. Large parking space free for 3 hrs.

Toilets could be better maintained but the rest of the shop is fine.
Very helpful loads of stuff at good prices to buy
